Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory541.jpg'}
{3: 'As the dust from the collapse gradually settles, the imprisoned corpses finally regain their freedom, scattering under the winter sky.'}
{3: 'From beneath the layers of rubble, a frail and elderly figure emerges.'}
{3: 'He struggles to free himself from the weight of the corpses piling above him, managing to squeeze half his body out.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: '...Still trying to drag me down... Tch!'}
{3: 'Bethe raises his head, looking toward the flat road ahead, only to be greeted by a long-awaited sword.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Ui/Spine/UiSpine/UiCharacterTower/NuoanTower/NuoanTower02.prefab'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Where is that person?'}
{3: 'The young man steps on him, coldly pressing for information.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Wh-what are you talking—'}
{3: 'Before he can finish pretending ignorance, Bethe feels a sharp pain piercing his left collarbone.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Ahhhhhhhh!!'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I won't waste time on other questions. You're not going to tell the truth anyway, and I don't have the patience either."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Tell me, where is the commandant?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'You bastard, arrrgh... How dare you treat an old man like this...!'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Have you ever considered this question when you torture those children to death?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Children? Haha, I see...'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'So, you went through all this trouble just to seek revenge for my little daughter?'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I'm indeed grateful to Bella, and it pains me that I couldn't save her. However, if she chose not to mention you, I shouldn't act on something I have no right to know."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'This is for those who lost their lives here, and for the children you might harm in the future.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "As for the rest, I believe you're well aware."}
{3: 'Noan raises his leg and forcefully stomps down on his other collarbone.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Arrrrgh! S-stop! Stooop!!'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Give me the location.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Right, in your dreams! Will you let me go if I tell you? Even the replica Lithos sent is better than you... At least he would...'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'That\'s because you made "that me" forget what happened after the Cargo Crew\'s rebellion failed.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "If there's anything that could alter my decision without me realizing it, this would be the only way."}
{3: "Noan twists his wrist, driving the sword into Bethe's squirming hand at his side, letting the blade slice through half of his palm."}
{3: "Screams of unrelenting agony burst forth from the old man's mouth once again, still unanswered."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Still trying to buy some time, huh? Are you so confident that he will come to your rescue?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Buy time from a rabid dog?'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'If you had approached me with a more "negotiable" stance from the beginning, I wouldn\'t have had to meet you this way.'}
{3: "Noan once again raises his leg, stepping on Bethe's right chest."}
{3: 'Even without any force exerted, the old man, who revels in punishing children, trembles like a leaf in the cold wind.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "You traitor! Even Rachel was mistaken about you... The failure of the Cargo Crew's rebellion was a direct result of your final decision!"}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "And here you are, harming their very benefactor! Without the weapons I supplied to the Cargo Crew, you wouldn't even have that sword in your hand!"}
{3: "Upon hearing these words, Noan's expression remains unchanged."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Where did those weapons you provided actually come from? And how many of them... were just cast-offs from the upper class?'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "You knew what Captain Rachel was preparing for, and you still introduced to Ashlar someone who could sell those military circular machines behind her back, didn't you?"}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'How did you know?!'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Babylonia holds much more intel than the ground. It's just a matter of verifying the sources and adding some speculation to grasp the connection."}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Babylonia? Heh...'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "To Babylonia, you're just a handy soldier, nothing different from cargo or tools."}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "You may think you're clever... but regardless, you're just a sheepdog among the pack, ready to be replicated, mass-produced, and discarded at their whims!"}
{3: 'Noan scoffs at the facts laid out by him.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Say what you will. I only care how the people I care about see me.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'To put it in another way...'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'If you see me as a sheepdog, how dare you take the sheep away from me?'}
{3: 'Bethe gasps for air, his body trembling from the waves of pain coursing through him.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: '"Rabid dogs like the Cargo Crew will bite until their very last breath." Isn\'t that what you said?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'Haha... Cargo Crew... Rachel used to tell me all the time...'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "That you were a good kid... Now I see, she was betrayed because she didn't know the real you...!"}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Captain Rachel had seen me do similar things when I was nine. She just didn't need to tell you about the real me."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Just because I've learned to restrain myself these years, it doesn't mean I can treat people like you the same."}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Have you bought enough time? Will "that me" really come?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'No matter what you become, you will always be a traitor!'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I'll ask one last time: where is the commandant?"}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: 'You should have ******* died in the snow alongside Rachel and those bastards of the Cargo Crew!'}
{3: "Noan, without uttering another word, steps down on Bethe's chest."}
{3: 'Immediately, the ribs near the abdomen emit faint cracking sounds, overwhelmed by his screams of agony.'}
{3: "Noan pauses briefly, granting Bethe a moment to catch his breath and speak, while also exerting control over his force to ensure he doesn't immediately end the man's life."}
{3: 'This is a "judgment" detached from the notions of right or wrong, witnessed by the remnants of countless deceased.'}
{3: 'The executioner displays neither the pleasure of cruelty nor any mercy as he metes out violence with violence.'}
{3: 'Only the Rev Blade is trembling slightly in the hand of its owner—'}
{3: "Beneath that tranquil expression as cold as a winter night lies Noan's soul, trembling from painstakingly suppressing the rage that threatens to consume him."}
{3: 'From the ribs, down to the shins, and further to the knees...'}
{3: 'When all hope of escape is mercilessly ripped away from his aged body, Bethe finally capitulates amidst his own lugubrious screams.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "The location... Arrgh... I'll tell you..."}
{3: 'Shivering, he spits out the coordinates, a location situated a full 77 kilometers away.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'You\'re hoping "that Noan" will come rushing to your rescue, but the commandant with him is this far away?'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "...I-it's true. If you don't believe me, take me with you..."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory213.png'}
{2: "He's lying, Noan!", 3: '86'}
{3: 'The secret channel, after a long silence, finally transmits a familiar and urgent voice.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: 'Commandant...! Where are you now?', 4: '18'}
{2: '(Give a rough direction)', 3: '90'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "This location... It's close... The seaside lighthouse?", 4: '18'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Ui/Spine/UiSpine/UiCharacterTower/NuoanTower/NuoanTower02.prefab'}
{3: 'The human voice gets drowned out by a burst of static before being cut off completely.'}
{2: 'Bethe', 3: "No, it's not me. I didn't—"}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'The roaring engine of the Rev Blade puts everything to silence.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory711.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory711.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: "That's all that needs to be said.", 4: '1'}
{3: "He gazes at the human's terminal in his hand, contemplating its destruction, but eventually turns it off and tosses it over, along with the firefly."}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'If "that Noan" has memories, he\'ll soon find this place.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thank you for giving back the terminal.', 3: '116'}
{3: "After hearing Bethe and Noan's conversation through the comms, the young man's attitude finally starts to waver."}
{3: "...Yet, he continues to assert that he hasn't placed his trust in anyone."}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "It wouldn't be surprising if either Babylonia or the Ascendants were to lie.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Lithos would often put on some realistic plays. No one can guarantee that Bethe isn\'t orchestrating something else with "the other me."', 4: '1'}
{3: "The young man's voice suddenly softens."}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Lithos does have intentions to take away "the other me" and also forbids me from killing... him.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'It took me a long while to finally find an opportunity to persuade Bethe to act on his own.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'If what he says is true, that the "other me" is the real one, and only the original M.I.N.D. can be replicated.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Then his actions to restrict me make sense.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "...The feeling of discord in my memories, perhaps it's due to this.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "I still can't fully trust what you've said.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Who knows if these voices are orchestrated to stage this play?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Even upon realizing the truth, this person, burdened with too many lies, still stubbornly refuses to believe.'}
{3: 'He wavers in his hesitation.'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'If one day... the memories I recover align with what you or "the other Noan" have said...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The young man leans against the wall, remaining silent for a long, long time.'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "No, apologizing won't make up for anything... I must do something.", 4: '1'}
{3: "In this moment, those unfamiliar, clouded eyes take on a striking resemblance to Noan's."}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "Until these matters are verified, I will continue to see both your words and Lithos' as lies.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He reverts back to his indifferent demeanor.'}
{2: 'What exactly does Lithos want from you?', 3: '143'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Some "bricks," to either toss at people or construct walls.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He points at himself expressionlessly.'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "I've seen Lithos die in front of me twice now, and each Lithos is slightly different.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'The current him just wants a bit of entertainment to kill the boredom and a tool that comes in handy.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'You know this, and you still choose to help him?', 3: '148'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Help? Of course not.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "He granted me the ability to resist the virus and the Red Tide, and access to the Ascendants' plan. We're simply using one another.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Better than being "the other me," always under someone\'s watch and restricted in everything.', 4: '1'}
{3: "As this is mentioned, a flash of resentment crosses the young man's eyes."}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "He's been in Babylonia for quite some time, right? Has he ever achieved anything?", 4: '1'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'The arrangements with Dark Aries indeed have flaws.', 3: '156'}
{2: "But that doesn't mean they've been sitting there and doing nothing.", 3: '157'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "It's just some more trouble. He's better off being killed here by me.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "With the original one gone, there will be no more replicas created. It's better this way.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'I don\'t need so many replicas of myself... "That Noan" would think the same.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With his head lowered, he mutters to himself amidst a whirlwind of thoughts and self-doubt.'}
{2: 'How about coming back with me?', 3: '162', 4: 'How about leaving Lithos first?', 5: '163'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "Add another one to your fancy prison? An upper-echelon like you surely can't understand how disgusting that is, can you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: '...There are still some issues with my frame that only he can resolve.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: "But your memory isn't complete right now.", 3: '166'}
{2: "You'll eventually realize this path has strayed from your will.", 3: '167'}
{2: 'What will you do then?', 3: '168'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "I'll worry about that when the day comes. I still can't trust the words I hear here.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He stands up and pushes open the door of the cell.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory598.jpg'}
{3: 'The harsh winter sea wind lashes the lighthouse, its mournful wails echoing through the air.'}
{3: 'Low-hanging, somber clouds sprawl across the sky, their presence dark and ominous.'}
{3: "Amidst the biting cold, a figure hurries up to the lookout platform on the outer edge of the lighthouse's peak."}
{3: 'Noan halts before this individual, so very similar to himself.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'His gaze sweeps over those dim eyes and the wound on his chest, confirming that this frame is still under the control of the Ascendants.'}
{3: 'The young man who has lost his name also lifts his gaze toward "the other him."'}
{3: "However, his gaze quickly shifts past him, landing on the nearby human commandant, ensuring the latter's safety."}
{3: '"This Noan" is stating the harsh truth with his indifference—'}
{3: 'Even caged, he still lives among those beyond his reach, living in his own "present."'}
{3: 'Even caged, the path of the Transcendant remains unworthy of mention.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Why can you so firmly believe that your choice is the correct one?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Long concealed, the sludge that has accumulated in his heart finally breaks free from its confines in this very moment.'}
{3: 'The nameless replica sneers, at the puppet whose every word and action is being watched.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The Rev Blade pierces through the air, its sound almost simultaneous with the scoffing laughter, as the Transcendant reaches Noan in the blink of an eye.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{3: "In this fleeting moment of blades clashing, Noan, ever vigilant, blocks the Transcendant's strike with the two swords at his side."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Why... why is a puppet living in a cage the real me?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Uttering this unbearable truth, he gradually increases the force exerted into his Rev Blade.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: "If you're so desperate to end the troubles caused by the replicas, why don't you just die here...!", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiSHanshuoNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryGanRanNew.prefab', 2: '2', 3: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiDuihualiziLoopRed.prefab', 2: '2'}
{3: 'The Punishing Virus carried by the Transcendant transforms into crimson electric currents, spreading uncontrollably with his every movement.'}
{3: 'Corruption entwines, eroding the clean frame—as if determined to drag him down to hell.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: 'Without the original, there will be no more replicas!', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiDuihualiziLoopRed.prefab'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryGanRanNew.prefab', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lightning bursts forth from the clashing blades, emitting a dazzling light.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The two similar figures fight atop the lighthouse with nearly identical styles, their silhouettes blending seamlessly.'}
{1: '1', 3: "After a night of intense battles, Noan's movements have become sluggish."}
{1: '1', 3: 'As the power of the Transcendant is enhanced, he can wield this Rev Blade to strike heavier slashes even without the off-hand sword from the past.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'PanelActor2Shake'}
{1: 'PanelActor2Shake'}
{1: 'RImgBg1Shake'}
{1: 'RImgBg1Shake'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The two Rev Blades briefly cross again, while Noan dodges relentlessly amidst the corruption and the overwhelming attacks.'}
{1: '1', 3: "—He can't make it if this drags on."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Sidestepping the lightning spray of the blade, Noan takes two swift steps on the railing before leaping from the height.'}
{3: 'In a desperate move, the Rev Blade strikes the figure below, the engine roaring thunderously. However, in the very instant, he suddenly abandons all resistance.'}
{3: 'Losing his target, the Transcendant stumbles sharply, and when he turns back, the long-prepared off-hand sword is descending from above!'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The young man, covering his injured right eye, quickly retreats and looks up at Noan with his teeth gritted.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab'}
{3: 'Despite his attempt to readjust and attack, his frame responds with unexpected sluggishness and stiffness.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiDuihualiziLoopRed.prefab', 2: '2'}
{3: 'What follows is a sudden rise in the concentration of the Punishing Virus in the air.'}
{3: "In the next second, countless crimson spikes burst forth from the Transcendant's sides, screaming as they launch attacks in all directions."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: 'Watch out, Commandant!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'His vision, disrupted and distorted, becomes enveloped in red—a telltale sign that Lithos is nearby.'}
{2: 'Noan?', 3: "...It can't be. If he were nearby, he wouldn't just do this.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiDuihualiziLoopRed.prefab'}
{3: 'Caught off guard by the sudden turn of events, the young man involuntarily steps back, inching closer to the seaside railing.'}
{3: 'Just two steps away from plunging into the sea, a pair of hands firmly grasp his collar.'}
{3: 'Before he can make sense of what has happened, a greater pain suddenly pierces through—'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab', 2: '2'}
{3: "The off-hand sword stabs into his eye socket, helping its master pull out the young man's struggling eyeball."}
{3: 'Covering the eye that constantly leaks vital fluid, the Transcendant lets out a short cry of agony amidst the intense pain.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: 'Lucky me. It only takes one wound to find the "monitor" left by Lithos... although he may have left behind other things too.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: 'What did you say?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiSHanshuoNew.prefab'}
{1: '1', 3: '—He is shocked to find that his vision, covered in red, is starting to recover.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "This maneuver's classic Lithos, always keeping tabs on you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Lay a finger on that watchful eye, and suddenly you're branded a rebel.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Next thing you know, he's pulling the strings, commandeering your frame.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With hands pierced by those wicked Punishing spikes, he clutches onto the poor young man who tries to step back.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Still not getting it? Who's the real puppet here?!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: "Can't handle Lithos? Step aside and let me handle it.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The young man\'s senses are still in disarray as he stares at his "self," murmuring.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan?', 3: "Yeah, you've wandered off the path. It's time you got back in line.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The stray shadow chuckles at himself.'}
{3: 'He leans in close to his "true self," whispering a sentence softly...'}
{3: 'The overcast sky rumbles faintly, a chilly wind carrying the mocking curse into his ears.'}
{3: 'Seizing the momentary doubt those words have brought, the "shadow" breaks loose from the grasp of his "other self" and plunges back into the deep sea below the lighthouse.'}
{3: "Without a second thought, Noan hops onto the railing, following his silhouette and leaping off the tower's peak!"}
{3: 'In a last-ditch effort, you manage to snag his injured hands just in time.'}
